channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9247] Cleanup Key/KV/Meta/MetaKey Comparators
item.description:
HBASE-9164 converted KVComparator's KeyCompare#compare guts from one that assumed a contiguous array backing a KV to one that used the Cell interface which doesn't have this assumption.

There is now duplicate code that should be cleaned up.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This is like pulling a string that keeps unraveling more. This will likely end up looking like a drastic change but I think it is necessary to simplify the code.

My goal is to:

  • Simplify KVComparator+KeyComparator/MetaComparator+MetaKeyComparator down to KVComparator and MetaComparator.

First I did this – (minor api semantics change):

  • Fixed defaults in HFile.Writer factory to default to Key-format-aware comparator (KeyComparator, later converted to KVComparator) instead of a Key-format oblivious byte[] comparator. (Essentially all instances require specifying KEY_COMPARATOR – why not just make it the default).
    • Found that TestSeekTo, TestReseekTo and a handful of others depend on a different comparator because – HBASE-7845 "breaks" these tests.
  • Moved getComparator into TableName. (removed an instanceof bad smell)

I've also working on these which will change API type signatures:

  • Convert of RawComparator<byte[]> -> RawComparator<Cell> (seems like incorrect use of generics)
  • .. (more to come.)

Some questions: Why is the Comparator serialized into part of the HFile? Beyond Meta Key and a normal Key, is there external uses of his that I'm not aware of that I may break? (Phoenix?)

Why is the Comparator serialized into part of the HFile?

Long time ago, it 'made sense' that we note the comparator used writing the file so the reader used same.

Beyond Meta Key and a normal Key, is there external uses of his that I'm not aware of that I may break? (Phoenix?)

No. Way too exotic for outside clients to even know this facility even existed.
I created a separate issue for some of the completed work as HBASE-9262

There are three comparators being used – MetaKey, Key and RawComparator (for bloom filter's FileTrailer section..). I have a version that isolates the KeyComparators from the KVComparators, still cleaning it up.

Big patch touching lots of files but the take away is ~10% less code in KeyValue, (~2891 loc -> 2559 loc).

KeyValue is public and so are its old comparators; there is some thoughts about compatibility policy we'll need to consider.
review board here: https://reviews.apache.org/r/13769/

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12599575/hbase-9247.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 42 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 8 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 2 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Looked at the HFile subsets of the patch. lgtm. Can we just drop the comparator details from HFileV3 totally? Looks like we don't need it in the FFT.
I don't think we can drop it (there is instantiation related code that takes the name). Ideally though we should decouple the classname from what is written in the file in an HFileV3.
Thanks for reviews stack and andrew. commited to 0.95/0.96 branch and trunk.
hbase-9247.v2.95.patch is I committed to 0.95/0.96. a trivial change from v2 for trunk,
+1 was in review board.
